resources.string: Configurable background location polling and storage
No current Google user is saved
Edit Android Location / Wi-Fi settings, Resource priority setting, Wake lock settings
Fire Updates, Manual Sync, View History Details
Send a fire update request to a friend via SMS message
Send a Maps link of your last updated location to a friend
Display details of the most recent location polled
Display details of the last errors thrown by application
Display details of the most recent update requests

This application was originally designed to integrate with Google Latitude and replace its location services. With the Google Latitude shutdown on August 9, 2013, Backitude will need to be tremendously overhauled to bring about new functionality. The design is yet to be defined and come together, so please have patience.
Backitude is a background service application that polls your current location at a specified time interval using GPS, Wi-Fi, and/or Cell Tower triangulation.

When an accurate location value is achieved, the application will allow for a variety of location storage and export options. Integrate SMS reply for friends, Dropbox and Google Drive for storage and sharing, KML export, and custom server posts. The rest is yet to be determined!
Off-line Location Storage and Sync Settings
Edit polling preferences for standard background application behavior
Frequency for polling your current location
Maximum length of time for polling locations. Polling will stop when an accurate reading is achieved or the timeout is reached (to preserve battery)
Set the location provider priority to preserve battery by aborting GPS polling when Wi-Fi location is acquired. Or eliminate the use of GPS polling altogether.
Adjust the timestamps according with the Android time zone offset
Edit general update preferences for application
Minimum frequency for storing and sync\'ing the last detected location. (Used to bypass minimum distance filter which may prevent locations from being stored)
Location will not be stored unless the change in distance from the previous location is greater than the minimum distance value.
If another app locates your position accurately, Backitude will "steal" this location value and store your location. A successful "steal" will also restart your timed update interval.
The fastest rate at which eligible "steals" will be stored when available. (A buffer time between "steals")
Determines what action to take if the minimum accuracy requirements are not met during location polling for a new location
Update with the most accurate location acquired during location polling, or repeat previous update if no new locations were found at all.
Update with the most accurate location acquired during location polling, but do not update if no new locations were found at all.
If new location value is not found or does not meet minimum accuracy requirements, repeat previous update
If new location value is not found or does not meet minimum accuracy requirements, do not update location
If a new location is less accurate than the previous, and the previous location falls within the bounds of the new location, the application will repeat the previous location value.
Edit polling preferences for application behavior while plugged into a power supply
When plugged into a power supply or "docked" with the GPS enabled, app will automatically switch polling intervals for Docked Mode and switch back if un-plugged.
Frequency for polling location values while in Docked Mode with device charging and GPS enabled.
Maximum length of time for polling locations when using Docked Mode updating. Polling will stop when an accurate reading is achieved or the timeout is reached
Edit polling preferences for application behavior while connected to a Wi-Fi network.
When connected to a Wi-Fi network, app will automatically switch polling intervals for Wi-Fi Mode and switch back to standard mode if disconnected from the network.
Frequency for polling location values while in Wi-Fi Connected Mode.
Maximum length of time for polling locations while in Wi-Fi Connected Mode. Polling will stop when an accurate reading is achieved or the timeout is reached
Edit preferences for receiving "Fire Update" requests from others via SMS
Allow others to send an automatic update trigger to your phone via SMS messaging
Application will send location back via SMS messaging to the number that originally requested the Fire Update.
A message is displayed to the screen when a Fire Update request is received from a friend
Display a notification bar message when a Fire Update request is received from a friend

A secret suffix phrase can be required at the end of your incoming "Force Backitude Update" SMS commands to prevent unwanted push updates from other users. Set a secret suffix here and share with your desired friends to apply to their push updates. (ie, "Force Backitude Update12345")
Show a status bar icon in the notification area
After polling for a new location and attemping to store the value, a message is briefly displayed on the screen indicating success or failure.
Display a notification bar message when the application fails on a request.
GPS Location detection is currently turned on
Cell Tower/Wi-Fi Location detection is currently turned on.
GPS and Cell Tower/Wi-Fi location detections are currently turned on.
All location providers are currently turned OFF, application cannot function properly.
Location polling will require an accuracy value of at least this degree before stopping to update unless the timeout occurs.
Location polling will require an accuracy value of at least this degree before stopping to update unless the timeout occurs.
Wi-Fi connections are enabled..network locations should be more accurate if available
Wi-Fi connections are disabled.. If desired, enable for more accurate network locations.
When in sleep mode, wake the system to poll and update locations (system will resume sleeping after each update)
When in sleep mode, wake the Wi-Fi connection to poll and update locations (Wi-Fi will resume sleeping after each update)
Waking the Wi-Fi connection for polling and update capabilities.
Store location values on device if data network service is not available at the time of discovery. Values can be exported or shared at a later time once connected.
Select when the application will sync offline location records that have been stored on the device
Only sync when Wi-Fi connection is available.
After completing offline sync, a message is briefly displayed on the screen indicating success or failure.
Any stored records that have been successfully posted, will be removed from the local database.
Sends offline location values to customizable server URL for Location History. Stored values are automatically cleared upon successful transmission or export.
Sends offline location values to customizable server URL for Location History. Stored values are automatically cleared upon successful transmission or export. (records currently exist)
Sends offline location values to customizable server URL for Location History. Stored values are automatically cleared upon successful transmission or export. (No records currently exist)
Deletes the offline location values in storage.
Sending offline location to custom server location.
Sync Failure: reverting sync preference to "Manual"
Location values can be stored locally on the device in many different forms
Poll the current location and send a request to the custom server to test the settings
Configure a custom server to send location data to on the fly.
Choose which type of http post authentication method you would like to use for Custom Server POSTs
User name for authentication with server (may not be required)
Password for authentication with server (may not be required)
ID to distinguish device and user amongst other requests sent to server using the same authentication (may not be required)
A contact number may be assigned to each widget for auto-populating the SMS recipient address with the selected value, or the default will leave the recipient list (blank) to complete on click
The Location updating service may already be running
Steals and Minimum Time Interval will still be active as long as enabled
Steals will still occur as long as application is enabled
This mode can be utilized in an effort to conserve battery power
Minimum Time Interval will still occur as long as application is enabled
This mode is used to bypass minimum distance rules and maintain a minimum interval of location values
Backitude cannot perform any operations with this configuration.
Warning! Steals feature will only function if buffer rate is faster than current polling rate.
Repeats previous location value if it is more accurate and within accuracy vicinity of the newly polled location
No Device ID parameter key configured, value will not POST (configure below)
Application is currently polling for location updates.
Docked Mode updating interval is active.
Backitude has missed an update. Please try again, if problems persist contact developer.
Daily Update Limit for all users exceeded until 12:00AM EST(US)
Service can be unavailable for a number of reasons.
Backitude has uploaded all offline records to server.
Cannot store location at this time. No network signal available
Cannot store location at this time. No user account has been configured
Cannot store location at this time. No destination is defined.
Cannot send an update at this time. No Wi-Fi connection available while Data Roam/Reduction mode is enabled. Enable Offline Storage to sync at a later time.
Cannot Fire an update at this time. No network signal available
Cannot Fire an update at this time. No Wi-Fi connection available while Data Roam/Reduction mode is enabled. Enable Offline Storage to sync at a later time.
Cannot Fire an update at this time. (No configured Location providers are enabled)
Cannot Fire an update at this time. (Account unknown)
Cannot poll an update at this time. No network signal available
Cannot poll an update at this time. No Wi-Fi connection available while Data Roam/Reduction mode is enabled. Enable Offline Storage to sync at a later time.
No location providers enabled. (Backitude turning off)

No location providers enabled. This is due to your Google Location Services or GPS Location Services settings in Android Location settings, or your allowable location providers as specified in Backitude \> Advanced Settings \> Set Priority.
Cannot enable background service at this time. (No configured Location providers are enabled)
Cannot enable background service at this time. (Account unknown)

SMS is required to automatically ping your Backitude friends. If firing from a tablet or an SMS disabled device, try text emailing their device the phrase \"Force Backitude Update\" to perform the function.
Please see Error Log or contact developer for assistance.
Please try again later or contact developer.
There is a problem connecting to the database.
Here is a link to my location:
(Provided by Backitude, free in Google Play Store)
No apps available to share location.
No location value available to share.
